DOC.brief_summary: A novel infrared imaging tool to aid in the clinical detection of atypical pigmented lesions and melanoma is developed. Goals include evaluation of the utility of high-resolution infrared scanning of cutaneous lesions in the diagnosis of pigmented lesions and the identification of high-risk lesions and melanomas.
DOC.brief_title: Using High Resolution Function Imaging To Detect Melanoma and Dysplastic Nevi
DOC.criteria: Patients seen in the highrisk pigmented lesion clinic, who posses a pigmented lesion with a clinical indication for biopsy
